required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Ceftaroline Fosamil Versus Vancomycin Plus Aztreonam in the Treatment of Patients With Skin Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicentre, Randomised, Double-Blind Comparative Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ceftaroline Fosamil (600 mg Every 8 Hours) Versus Vancomycin Plus Aztreonam in the Treatment of Patients With Complicated Bacterial Skin and Soft Tissue Infections With Evidence of Systemic Inflammatory Response or Underlying Comorbidities

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of Ceftaroline Fosamil versus Vancomycin plus Aztreonam in treatment of patients with complicated bacterial skin and soft tissue infections.

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase III, Multicentre, Randomised, Double-Blind Comparative Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ceftaroline Fosamil (600 mg every 8 hours) Versus Vancomycin Plus Aztreonam in the Treatment of Patients with Complicated Bacterial Skin and Soft Tissue Infections With Evidence of Systemic Inflammatory Response or Underlying Comorbidities

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) in Modified Intent-to-treat (MITT) Analysis Set
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in MITT. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at TOC in Clinically Evaluable (CE) Analysis Set
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in CE. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per Patient Microbiological Response at TOC in Microbiologically Modified-intent-to-treat (mMITT) Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in microbiological favorable response rate at TOC in mMITT analysis set. Favorable microbiological response rate is measured by comparing TOC microbiological data to baseline microbiological data. In the absence of TOC microbiological data it is presumed from the clinical response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per-patient Micro Response at TOC in Microbiologically Evaluable (ME) Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in microbiological favorable response rate at TOC in ME. Favourable microbiological response rate is measured by comparing TOC microbiological data to baseline microbiological data. In the absence of TOC microbiological data it is presumed from the clinical response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at End of Treatment (EOT) in MITT Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On day of last dose of study drug (or + 1 day)
secondary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at EOT (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in MITT. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at EOT visit to those recorded at study baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at EOT in CE Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On day of last dose of study drug (or +1 day)
secondary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at EOT (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in CE. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at EOT visit to those recorded at study baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Relapse at Late Follow-up (LFU) in CE Patients Who Were Cured at TOC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 21 to 42 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical relapse rates at LFU (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in CE. Clinical relapse rate at LFU is measured by comparing a patient's signs and symptoms at late follow-up to those when they were cured at TOC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Early Response at 48 to 72 Hours of Treatment in MITT Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 to 72 hours after first dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: The observed difference in the early success rates at 48 to 72 hours of treatment (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in MITT. Early response rate as measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at the 48-72 hour visit to those recorded at study baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Per-pathogen Microbiological Response at TOC by Baseline Pathogen From Site of Skin Infection in ME
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Per-pathogen microbiological response at TOC by baseline pathogen from site of skin infection in ME analysis set

clinical_study.condition: Complicated Skin and Soft Tissue Infection

arm_group.description: Patients will receive 600 mg of ceftaroline fosamil administered as a 120-minute intravenous infusion very 8 hours. Each dose will be infused in a volume of 250 mL over 120-minutes followed by aztreonam placebo in a volume of 100 mL infused over 30 minutes every 8 hours. In addition vancomycin placebo will be given in a volume of 250 mL infused over 120 minutes every 12 hours. Doses will be adjusted according to the patient's renal function.

Patients will receive combination of vancomycin plus aztreonam. Dose of vancomycin will be based on the patient's actual weight and will receive intravenous vancomycin every 12 hours with each dose infused over 120-minutes. Aztreonam dose will be 1 gram intravenously in a volume of 100 mL infused over 30 minutes every 8 hours. In addition, ceftaroline fosamil placebo will be given in a volume of 250 mL infused over 120 minutes every 8 hours. Doses adjusted according to patients renal function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18 years or older
- Complicated skin and skin structure infection (cSSTI)
- Infection of sufficient severity to warrant hospitalization
- Infection of sufficient severity such that it is expected to require at least 5 days of intravenous antibiotic therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received systemic antibacterial drugs for greater than 24 hours within 96 hours prior to first dose of study drug
- Uncomplicated skin and skin structure infections, skin infections suspected to be caused by viral or fungal pathogens
- Diabetic foot infections, decubitus ulcers, ulcers due to peripheral vascular disease
- Infection caused by human or animal bites, sternal wound infections, bone infection or arthritis due to an infection, critical limb ischemia of the affected limb
- Chronic liver disease or severe impaired renal function, severe low white blood cell count, burns on greater than 15% of total body surface area, necrotizing skin infection, amputation required of primary site of infection, sustained shock

clinical_study.keyword: complicated skin and soft tissue infections (cSSTI)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Overall, 802 patients were enrolled from 111 centres in 6 regions in this study. The first patient was enrolled on 17 May 2012 and the last patient last visit was on 26 June 2014. Of 802 enrolled participants, 30 did not meet the eligibility criteria and 11 were randomized but not treated.

group.title: Ceftaroline
group.description: Ceftaroline fosamil at 600 mg every 8 hours (q8h)

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Lack of therapeutic response and other

baseline.population: 761 randomized patients who received any amount of study therapy. there are 11 patients who are randomized , but didn't receive any study therapy.

group.title: Ceftaroline
group.description: Ceftaroline fosamil at 600 mg every 8 hours (q8h)

outcome.title: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) in Modified Intent-to-treat (MITT) Analysis Set
outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in MITT. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.
outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug

group.title: Ceftaroline
group.description: Ceftaroline fosamil at 600 mg every 8 hours (q8h)

measure.title: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) in Modified Intent-to-treat (MITT) Analysis Set
measure.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in MITT. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant's signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary objective of this study was to determine the noninferiority in the clinical cure rate for ceftaroline compared vancomycin plus azreonam group at TOC in both MITT and CE populations.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A two-sided 95% CI for the observed difference in the primary outcome measures (clinical cure rates) between ceftaroline group and vancomycin plus aztreonam group were calculated in both MITT and CE Populations at the TOC visit. Noninferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 95% CI was higher than –10% in both MITT and CE Populations.
analysis.estimate_desc: CI for risk difference was estimated by 95% using unstratified Miettinen and Nurminen CI.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at TOC in Clinically Evaluable (CE) Analysis Set
outcome.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in CE. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant’s signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.
outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug

group.title: Ceftaroline
group.description: Ceftaroline fosamil at 600 mg every 8 hours (q8h)

measure.title: Clinical Response at TOC in Clinically Evaluable (CE) Analysis Set
measure.description: The observed difference in the clinical cure rates at TOC (ceftaroline group minus vancomycin plus aztreonam group) in CE. Clinical cure rate is measured by comparing the participant’s signs and symptoms at TOC visit to those recorded at study baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary objective of this study was to determine the noninferiority in the clinical cure rate for ceftaroline compared vancomycin plus azreonam group at TOC in both MITT and CE populations.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A two-sided 95% CI for the observed difference in the primary outcome measures (clinical cure rates) between ceftaroline group and vancomycin plus aztreonam group were calculated in both MITT and CE Populations at the TOC visit. Noninferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 95% CI was higher than –10% in both MITT and CE Populations. If non-inferioirity was achieved then a test of superioirty was conducted if lower limit of 95% CI for the difference was >0%.
analysis.estimate_desc: CI for risk difference was estimated by 95% using unstratified Miettinen and Nurminen CI.

outcome.title: Per Patient Microbiological Response at TOC in Microbiologically Modified-intent-to-treat (mMITT) Analysis Set
outcome.description: Difference in microbiological favorable response rate at TOC in mMITT analysis set. Favorable microbiological response rate is measured by comparing TOC microbiological data to baseline microbiological data. In the absence of TOC microbiological data it is presumed from the clinical response.
outcome.time_frame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from time of the first dose of study drug up to TOC visit (8 to 15 days after the last dose). Serious AEs were collected from time of signature of informed consent up to the LFU visit (21 to 35 days after the last dose).

group.title: Ceftaroline
group.description: Ceftaroline fosamil at 600 mg every 8 hours (q8h)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator agrees not to use such Confidential study information and not to disclose them to any other third parties, except that the undersigned shall not be prevented from using or disclosing information: (a) which by written records was previously known; (b) which is now public knowledge, (c) which is lawfully obtained by the undersigned from sources who have a lawful right to disclose such information.
